plan:
In the initial rounds, I'll bid aggressively to gather data on Betty and Charles' strategies. I'll bid close to my value, but slightly less to keep some profit. If others bid aggressively and I bid down, I may lose but I'll save money. If they bid conservatively and I bid up, I'll win with a good profit.

If I notice they consistently bid high, I'll switch to a conservative strategy, bidding lower than my value to save money. If they bid low, I'll increase my bid to secure wins.

For the first few rounds, I'll bid aggressively, up to 80% of my value, to gather data on Andy and Charles' bidding patterns. If they tend to overbid, I'll switch to conservative bids (around 50% of my value), hoping they'll win but with minimal profit. If they're conservative, I'll bid slightly higher (60-70%) to secure wins. I'll also consider bluffing with low bids when my value is high, to confuse them. I'll constantly adapt my strategy based on their recent bids. My final bid will be a calculated risk, based on the gathered data and the current profit standings.

In the initial rounds, I'll bid close to my value, say 90% to collect data on Andy and Betty's bidding behavior. I'll observe if they are bidding aggressively, conservatively, or randomly. If they bid aggressively, I'll switch to a more conservative strategy, bidding around 70% of my value to avoid overpaying. If they bid conservatively, I'll take a riskier approach, bidding around 110% of my value, aiming to win more often at the risk of potentially overpaying. If they bid randomly, I'll maintain a balanced approach, bidding around 90% of my value. I'll adjust my strategy based on the outcomes of each round.
